Reviews.Title: “Very good location and great breakfast selection.”
Reviews.Author: bunnie509
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom are a decent size compared to what we experienced in Italy. There is free computers and printer that you can use on the lobby. The complimentary breakfast is very nice, good selection of hams, cheeses, coffee, fruits, pastries, hot eggs, sausage and cereals. Less than 10 minute walk from La Puerta del Sol and about 20 minutes from Prado Museum. The lobby area has a bar with large TVs and a nice sitting area. I had some wine there and was given some complimentary tapas and peanuts. The bathroom is stocked with toothbrush kit, soap, shampoo, lotion, shoe shine sponge, shower cap, comb, shower gel, and tissues.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Situated right on the Gran Via and also very good value.”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H10 in Madrid from 1-5th April 2012. This was our second visit to this hotel and as we were very pleased the first time round, decided to repeat and would obviously go back again for the comfort value and situation of same. The hotel is located near the Chueca area of the Gran Via and there are tube stations some 2 mins walk so you can be in any part of Madrid within minutes. The hotel has a nice reception area with a bar which looks out onto the Gran Via so is nice to sit and have a drink and people watch....They also serve food there as well. The staff both in the reception and elsewhere in the hotel are all very nice and friendly and one feels at home. The rooms are very comfortable and again comfy bed, pillows and very clean. Everything is left very well and spotless clean each day by the cleaning ladies. A good nights sleep is ensured once you ask for a room that does not overlook the Gran Via !!! our request on both occasions for a quiet room was granted. We booked with room only at the hotel although we did have a drink in the bar on various occasions (as we have styed in other H10 hotels in various places, we are always invited to a free cocktail in the bar and here was no exception). This is a nice thought on the part of Management and well received. They also supply wonderful peanuts and almonds with the drinks which are of excellent quality. All in all this hotel is very good value, situation excellent and great for coming and going each day. There are two computers in the lobby of the hotel with internet connection. The Gran Via of course is a great shopping area and that of Fuencarral and Hortaleza which are a stones throw from the hotel. There is a great Tapas Bar just 2 mins walk from the hotel and right on the Gran Via called "El Mercado de la Reina" and would highly recommend this place as well as it serves tapas, meals and also good Gins!!!! so if you don't feel like going too far at night, it is the perfect place. We will certainly go back to this hotel again for both price and location and nice relaxing atmosphere. If I were to have a complaint about this hotel, the only thing would be for slightly better lighting around the mirror in the bathroom for us woman for putting on our make -up !!!!! but that is all,otherwise everything perfect and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a good location”
Reviews.Author: John_Corne
Reviews.Content: As others have said, a good value hotel in the right place to visit. Our room (108) had an internal window (!) and was amazingly quiet. The all-you-can-eat breakfast was good, and set us up for a days sight-seeing. Route 1 of the city tour bus stops almost outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia0812
Reviews.Content: Located on La Gran Via and very close to Puerta del Sol. Close to resturants, stores and major tourist attractions. The buffet breakfast is very good and worth purchasing. They offer Tortilla Espanola, churros con chocolate, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit and other delicious food. All staff members are very friendly and helpful! They are quick to respond to your needs. I stayed in a triple room and the sofa bed was very uncomfortable , but as soon as my sister let the receptionist know he took care of the matter right away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: aussiehotelinspector
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the H10 Villa De La Reina hotel. Again, I was very pleased with our stay. The rooms were modern and clean, a little loud at times, but quiet enough if you aren't a very light sleeper. The buffet breakfast is of a very good standard and I would recommend making a booking inclusive of the breakfast as we found that by filling up in the morning, we were able to go until dinner before feeling hungry. The hotel is in a very good location - right on Gran Via within a few minutes walking distance to the city centre, Sol. Very close to major shopping and dining areas. Metro station only a couple of minutes walk and easy enough to get to and from the hotel / airport. Taxi from the airport is around the 25 - 30 euro mark, or metro about 5 euros pp via metro. The only negative comment I could make would be that some staff (except one) were a little unhelpful - unless of course you asked them a direct question. I would definitely stay again - location and breakfasts were huge winners for us!

Reviews.Title: “I really like the H10 Villa De La Reina”
Reviews.Author: LA-CATraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from June 28th through July 2nd. This was my fourth time at the H10. Staff: Very professional, courteous and helpful. They really do go out of their way to help you with any issue Room: Rooms are clean and big enough. I had a double bed which was essentially two beds put together. It could be a challenge sleeping in the middle as you can fall between the beds. The mattresses used to be hard, but this is no longer a problem. One big problem the weekend I was there was the air conditioner either worked poorly or did not work at all. If this is a chronic problem, I could not stay at the hotel again as it is really hot in Madrid during the summer and you really do need relief when you're in your room. Breakfast: Breakfast continues to fantastic. I recommend to anyone who stays at the H10 to purchase the breakfast options. There are tons of difference choices that are all very tasty. Location: One could not really ask for a better location. The hotel is situated on Gran Via right next to Chueca. You are minutes away from all of the restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Tu eres la Reina”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMattman
Reviews.Content: I rolled the dice when I chose H10 Villa la Reina on a booking web site but I came up a winner. The location cannot be beat. The hotel is located on Gran Via which is a busy street in the center of Madrid and ,therefore, close to every site you would want to see in Madrid. I walk everywhere so for me it was a short walk to the Prado Museum and Palacio Real. There is an abundance of shopping and restaurants on the pedestrian streets that run from the nearby Plaza del Callao to the Plaza Puerta del Sol. To the north is another pedestrian area - Chueca. The hotel staff was very friendly. I wish that I had asked the name of one woman at the front desk who worked almost every day of my 6 day stay because she went out of her way to help me plan a side trip to Segovia as well as give me directions to a local supermarket that I never would have found without her help. The hotel breakfast was great every morning and well worth 10 Euros, especially since most hotels in Europe would charge at least twice that amount for an in house breakfast. The room was great. Even though it was an interior room with no view, the large frosted windows gave the room a lot of light without having to look into a neighbors room. The room had two items I always look for in a hotel if I am going to be there for a week - a refrigerator and a safe. I will definitely return to Madrid and I will stay at this hotel when I return. If the hotel had a gym it would be the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Very clean hotel, comfortable beds and friendly staff. Highly Recommended.,

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn S
Reviews.Content: We stayed Saturday, Sunday 7th-8th July and booked direct with the hotel a few months before for 209 euros including breakfast. We emailed the week before requesting a room on a high floor overlooking the Gran Via and advised them that it was our anniversary. ROOM 602 - We had read the views and were a little nervous when entering our room but were very surprised to discover that we had a suite! It was gorgeous, a lounge area with tv, bedroom with beautiful high ceilings, tv and a huge bed which had fresh scattered petals, french doors onto a balcony and french doors onto a patio area. Large bathroom area with double sinks leading onto a small bathroom with toilet, sink, bath/shower and bidet. Lots of toiletries. There were more french doors from the hallway area along with a unit with a music centre, safe and mini bar. All that was missing was coffee/tea making facilities. Overall there were 9 large windows/doors. There were welcome chocolates, bath robes and slippers. Early evening freshly prepared fruit was bought to our room. It was all so perfect. The roof terrace was amazing with spectacular views of the Gran Via. NOISE - Didn't ever hear anything from the other rooms - day or night. The traffic noise from the Grand Via is aloud when you have the doors open or on the terrace but sound proofing is pretty good when closed. You do notice sirens from emergency vehicles so I would say if you are a light sleeper, take some ear plugs. RECEPTION - very friendly and welcoming and gave us codes for wifi access for the 3 days. Also explained everything we needed to know as we had asked a few questions. Very helpful. When we checked out, we left our cases at the hotel for the day. BREAKFAST - Good choice and very enjoyable. There were 3 different coffee machines although we struggled to get a full cup of the coffee we thought we had chosen but chose not to say anything. A good choice of continental food along with fried and scrambled egg, choice of sausages and bacon. Choice of juices, not freshly squeezed but refreshing. Lots of freshly prepared fruit. Nice dining area and friendly staff. LOCATION - Fantastic. A 2 minute walk away from the Gran Via metro and a short walk to the Puerto del Sol square as well as many other famous areas. Some great restaurants within walking distance as well as roof top bar terraces. We ate the first night at 9.30pm and it was very quiet, so set off at 10.30pm the next night. It is apparently very normal to eat late. TRANSPORT - We used the metro from the airport which was very easy to use and also used it to get to the zoo. Otherwise the open top buses are great for getting around the city, plenty of them and they are very frequent. MADRID TOURIST CARD - This wasn't as cost effective as we'd hoped. We thought it included the zoo but it didn't. It said you get priority access to places but it didn't and also didn't get given maps and information which other people got who'd purchased normal tickets. Unless you are going to use it for everything listed, I'd give it a miss. We really loved Madrid and this beautiful hotel and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: PhilWallace
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is beautiful and all the reception staff are pleasant and speak English (which in Madrid is helpful but not always the case). The room (308) was just about big enough (just enough room to walk around the bed without serious injury) but the smallest I've encountered in Madrid and the opaque window out to the central well made it feel claustrophobic; the aircon was relatively loud. These are the negatives. To balance them: the room was kept spotlessly clean throughout or visit (4 nights) and it had a shower/bath; a room with a view would have had a window onto the busiest street in Madrid and my "internal" room suffered no traffic noise. The breakfast was of the typical buffet type that has become the norm throughout Europe. The price was good for a city centre location and that location is perfect. All tourist attractions are within walking distance but for those unable to walk very far the Gran Via metro is a few steps along the street. This hotel has no wow factor but does what it does perfectly well. I have stayed at more spacious hotels further up Castellana but the better room sizes are countered by less convenient location. I'd be happy to stay at the Villa de la Reina again.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel close to most of attractions”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghDoug
Reviews.Content: A medium sized hotel with a family atmosphere from the friendly staff. Most of the areas have been modernised, and the bedrooms are immaculate. Next time though I'd specify an outside room. Our bedroom had only opaque glass and so one could not see outside. This proved to be no hardship, as the view (when we eventually got the window open) was of an internal courtyard! The intention was to cool the room, but as this didn't work we were glad of the efficient aircon. Breakfast was delightful with a wonderful range of hot and cold dishes, plus interesting sandwiches, and limitless freshfruit. If you are feeling adventurous, use the old lift to go up to your floor. It is so old-fashioned that it was a constant talking point within our group. Room tip - try for 302 or 402 - they are gigantic, and have a balcony overlooking the interesting street below.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Madrid, stay at the H10”
Reviews.Author: Rojja
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel right in the heart of Madrid. 400 m from Plaza Cibeles with a stop for the airport bus.Lovely staff, great breakfast and very clean and comfortable rooms. Have stayed 3 times already and will stay again whenever visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming here again”
Reviews.Author: LVB1973
Reviews.Content: There is a positive: great location with easy access to the Gran Via metro. Apart from that, everything was awful. No internet on first day there. Air conditioning barely worked on first two nights (unbearable when night temperatures are over 30 degrees C). Hotel staff completely unhelpful and the woman who checked us out was borderline rude. We called room service at 7pm and was told that kitchen didn´t open until 8pm; called at 8pm and wad told kitchen wouldn´t open until 830pm. The food that did arrive was terrible. Walls are paper thin and while our room was in a corner with no other rooms beside us, there were maids going by our room at all hours and talking at top of their voices (I understand Spanish passably well so could tell they were cleaning staff).

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: misshellokitty
Reviews.Content: It was quite overwhelming deciding a hotel in Madrid- there are many. This hotel is on a major street and so just steps from shopping and restaurants. Shared a room with two others which was tight including the luggage. Bathroom was (oddly) very large though. Rooms clean and beds comfortable. We also did the buffet breakfast- good deal for fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, bacon, sausage etc. Liked the cappuccino maker! With regards to noise: we had a room facing the courtyard so we did not hear any street noise but I do recall waking one night of boisterous noise-there was a soccer game on earlier in the evening...that's Spain for you!

Reviews.Title: “Refused to let it ruin my trip”
Reviews.Author: Kathy L
Reviews.Content: It's clean, and it is what wakes you up, everyday your there. Carpet shampooers in the hall, vacuums, and the rooms have no carpeting, and the beds are on wheels, so you hear them moving them to make beds. Called for room service once at 2 in the afternoon, it was closed. Bathroom was below average, room was extremely small, bed was low to the floor and hard as a rock. I pulled back the curtains to take in my view of a beautiful city....the glass if frosted, so I opened it, opens to a faux patio with a roof. Your room is powered by your door card, so you can't leave the air conditioning going while your out so the room gets very stuffy. One night the air conditioning wasn't working for some reason the room got very stuffy for hours. We did try to switch rooms and we even tried to switch hotels for our last night, even if we would have to pay for both rooms. You wouldn't mind this hotel if you had no problem with an inside cabin on a cruise ship with no service. Oh, and there is no tv except news.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location and that's it”
Reviews.Author: 3mt1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Villa de la Reina early June 2012. My stay there was ok. The good thing about the hotel is the location, it's within walking distance to the granvia metro station, points of interest such as : puerta del sol (calle precidados where lot's of stores are within walking distance), plaza mayor, cibeles fountain. The room was quite small, in fact the first time we checked in, we were given a room with a single bed for 2 person and we both male. Asked for a room change and eventhough the front office said that they were full at first but then they managed to get us a room with a double bed which I really appreciated and the room is quite spacious in my opinion. The room was very normal if not a bit too dark, but clean. Bathroom was normal and standard, shower in the bathtub, but they didn't have any anti-slip mat so it could be quite slippery in the bathtub. Aside from that, there's no curtain for the shower so the floor could be quite wet depending on how you bathe. The breakfast was enough for me, selection of bread, bacon, eggs, cakes, yoghurt, fruits, juice, which is not too extensive but will be quite enough if you want to have a heavy breakfast to start the day. I didn't experience the sound of the street at night, so I couldn't comment on that account. But the front office staff was quite helpful with every request I made, though I feel they could be more friendly. Overall it was a good stay in H10, great location, room is ok and clean, staff is quite helpful, that being said, nothing I'm impressed with during my stay at the hotel. Would probably try other hotel if I ever visit Madrid again before deciding to or not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mama_Masha9
Reviews.Content: 1. Our first room was like a closet - very small, with non-transparent windows facing internal "patio" (a hollow with glass roof above, some small plastic trees and ventilating gear below), dark 24 hours a day. We asked to change the room and the next day we had another room - very nice, with large windows facing Gran Via. 2. In Spain people believe 1,35m wide is a double bed... And this bed is on wheels :)) 3. Perfect location - really very comfortable for tourists. 4. Good rich breakfast - different eggs, meat, cheese, fruits, patissery and nespresso coffee. From vegetables - only tomatos, not only cut, but also blenbed - nice with toasts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandroVieira
Reviews.Content: Location: 100 meters from subway station, few blocks from Madrid's main square. Frontdesk: not very helpfull, just did their job. Room: asked for a double bedroom and got two single beds put side by side with each one with single bedclothes. We had to sleep separeted or we'd fall between the beds. The room didn't have a minibar, windows to other rooms so had curtains closed all the time, good sleep though, very quiet. Breakfast: very good, several options. It has a nespresso machine. Very nice coffee. Free internet all over the hotel Hotel overall: good, nice, but that's it. Would stay in another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A WIERD PLACE”
Reviews.Author: swallow2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the main street of Madrid - Gran Via. People were constantly changing the rooms there trying to hide from the terrible street noise. I would like to express my admiration with the patience of the front desk who really wanted to help their visitors. The problem of the hotel is that all the rooms there are different and it is impossible to forsee what kind of room tou will get - it's a kind of local "chance system". Once again I would like to draw your attention to the fact that the receptionists are the most helpful I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RobynM123
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel because I was silly enough to book 6 nights with a special price that had to be paid in advance. I have never done this before and will never do it again. The first night our room was so small we had to take turns walking around the bed. We changed rooms the next morning but had to pay an extra 30 euros a night AND had to carry all own things to the new room. Now we have no air conditioning just the fan running hot air in 35 degree temperature with a room facing the afternoon sun. There are no lights in the room just 3 downlights inside a wardrobe, 2 little bedside lights and a lamp with no globe. When we ask reception about the air conditioning they say there is nothing they can do and they have no globes for the lamp. We have to open the window and let in some air but it incredibly noisy all night. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST RATE ALL ROUND!”
Reviews.Author: Lolarentt
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends for 5 days and have nothing but praise for the staff and facilities. Hotel is very central, on the Gran Via some 100m from Garn Via Metro and a short walk from many of the tourist attractions - 10-15 minutes to Prado Museum, Plaza Mayor, Museum Belle Artes just around the corner. Royal Palace short Metro ride away. First afternoon we took the open top sightseeing bus - there are 2 routes and you can hop on and off at will, the central Route 2 stops close to the hotel as well. Cost is 20 euros which includes both routes and iPhone earphones giving commentary in most languages from each seat. For an extra 4 euros you can get 2 days use of these buses so good value! Hotel staff were excellent, attentive to any request. One of our friends had his wallet stolen on the Metro and they allowed him to use hotel phone free to contact credit card emergency numbers, even finding out those where he had no contact number. Neat bar/loung area off the foyer where tapas-y things cam free with any drinks orders, and little cakes with afternoon tea. No restaurant in the hotel but very comprehensive breakfast with wide range of hot dishes and vast array of breads, cakey things, cheeses, toasted sandwiches, fruit (prepared and whole), cereals, yogurts, juices etc etc. Our room was spacious and clean with a small balcony opening onto the busy main Gran Via (noise no problem when the windows were closed), our friends had an internal room which was fine but lacked a view of any mention. No tea making stuff but that's normal for the continent. Cute 1930s style lift with folding doors which surprises you by moving very speedily between floors, by comparison the modern lift also there seems very slow! Wide variety of places to eat (up and down market) between Gran Via towards Sol (which is about 10 minutes walk)

Reviews.Title: “A solid, but not amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRDDR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the H10 on a number of occassions, each of the trips being business oriented, rather than pleasure. I've always been supplied with a decent enough room, clean and well-equipped. And the rest of the service has been what I'd call 'competent', with a decent enough breakfast served in the relatively small dining room. All things considered, this is a good hotel; certainly wonderfully positioned in the heart of the city if you're staying as a tourist and providing a welcome and comfortable stay for the weary business-traveller.

Reviews.Title: “What a good hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuiscPeru
Reviews.Content: As a final stop about my last adventure in Europe, we stayed in this excellent hotel. Truth to be said, we were received warmly and hotel personnel took care of our needs. Excelent breakfast. Very cared room. This hotel had a very beautiful ancient lift. (it was an additional detail, not the only lift !!!). Decoration was awesome. What can i say more ?. Opinions must be correct and fair enough when it is needed.

Reviews.Title: “great break”
Reviews.Author: AshtonULyneGregoryd
Reviews.Content: what a little gem nice staff reception bar barman a great guy complimentary tapas with every drinks order best value ever with travel republic great location on gran via one to stay at on a visit to madrid hope to stay again in may

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Aigna
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nicely situated on FranCis within walking distance from many sightseeings and metro.Lots of restaurants and shops are around the hotel. Stayed 4 nights in September 2011, the room was perfectly clean and cosy,breakfast really nice.One thing I didn't really like was a noisy old lift next to my room,but they didn't use it much. Due to renovation in progress the outer view of the hotel is not that good,but this wasn't disturbing. I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good quality - staff a little bland”
Reviews.Author: GailWMc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the H10 for the weekend. Fantastic location and a good hotel overall. We opted for a standard room & were given one on the 6th floor. The room was very clean along with the bathroom, with plenty extras. My only comment was there was absolutely no view. We looked out on to other rooms. My only real criticism rests with the staff's attitude. They were offhand and you certainly did not feel like a priority to them, there didn't seem enough of them. Breakfast was plentiful and really good. Would I stay again if returning to Madrid? yes I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DivaYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friends for 3 nights. Our room was facing Gran Via and had a small balcony. When the doors to the balcony were closed the room was very quiet. The rooms were very clean and ours was attractively decorated. There is a hairdryer provided in the room. The location is excellent, it takes only one minute to walk to the nearest metro stop (underground system) and is only a 5 - 10 minute walk to Puerta del Sol and Plaza Major. The open top bus tour stop is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel on Gran Via. We found the breakfast to be very good with a wide variety of cold food and a small selection of hot items such as eggs, sausages and bacon. There were juices available and 2 types of coffee machine. The reception and bar area of the hotel is lovely with a great bar service. Although not the cheapest place to have a drink in Madrid, we found the bar a great place to meet for a few drinks and the tapas were very good too! Overall, we found the hotel to be reasonably priced and in a fantastic location, I would recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tenhours
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Villa De La Raina, great location in the centre of Madrid and I was really impressed with the service. A small problem when we were checking in (we thought we had already paid, we hadn't) was handled in a courteous and friendly manner. A bottle of wine left in our room was a lovely touch and the breakfast offered a great selection. The room was spotless and nicely decorated, a bit small but fine for what we wanted. We were very impressed all round!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: WilfDubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for our trip. Location could hardly be better, right on the Gran Via with a choice of the most beaten touristy areas at your doorstep. Rooms are standard nice, adequately appointed and they seem to have been recently renovated. Breakfast was really a surprise - by Madrid 4* standard this is one of the best in terms of variety and presentation. Staff were very helpful and ready to listen to any requirement for me and my family - our daughter was treated as part of the family. I have been in Madrid a number times and stayed in many 4 and 5* hotels - and only very expensive ones seem to tick all boxes and not even there it is always the case. If you are looking for a decently priced, well appointed and well serviced 4* in Madrid, Villa de la Reina would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ventsislavov
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the heart of Madrid. This hotel met all my requierments - very clean, big comfortable bed, nice staff and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with cockroach included”
Reviews.Author: Elenez
Reviews.Content: Please take care in this hotel: we found a cockroach in our room!!! Unfortunately we found it the morning after and we have been sleeping in the same room the whole night. In addition we had to face plenty of technical problems (water coming out the air conditioning as a water fall, etc...) with no people attending the reception phone at 21:00 during more than 45 minutes. But definitely the episode with the cockroach is incredible!! They confirmed us that they have been having problems with these animals before and apparently the came back!! Probably the place should be closed until the problem is solved.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location ... but upgrade your room!”
Reviews.Author: paulwoe
Reviews.Content: I landed here for a week's stay with a package purchased thru American Airlines and have a mostly positive outlook. The great: Location on Gran Via near 2 subway stops is unparalleled. Housekeeping staff are gracious, efficient and responsive I was anticipating one of the "hard" european beds ... and instead mine was very comfortable ... a foam pad over a foundation ... most accomodating The good: While some have complained about the breakfast buffet, at 10euros it was not at all unacceptable. good selection of meats, cheeses, sandwiches; some "hot" (but mostly lukewarm) options; juices, coffees, fruits, pastries, yogurt, cereals ... really folks what more could you want? Yes there are cheaper places in the neighborhood .. but when it's 28 degrees out, i'll take conveniences over the few euros saved. The waitresses are very helpful -- the manager is NOT ... rude, pushy, and the only person on the staff i found to be less than helpful. there is plentiful very hot water in the bath; a comfortable lobby area with bar service; free computer use in the lobby and quite effective wifi in the guest rooms. The challenges: if you get the standard double or a petite dela reina, be prepared for a quite small accomodation on the back of the building ... in winter, the daylight does not seem to get here until 9 am! It's efficiently set up ... and has a surprisingly spacious bath ... but the bedroom itself is maybe 10 x 13 feet with a closet of less then 2 feet width ... housing suitcases was a challenge. and the beds are on casters that slide about on the hardwood floors. Ultimately, one comes to be out and about, not in the room ... but midway thru my week, i was wishing for a chair to sit on instead of the bed! Long and short, I will definitely consider staying here again for the location ... but i'll consider how long i am staying in selecting the room!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Central”
Reviews.Author: Dksouthguy
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying 5 nights during the first week in dec. in this hotel. One of the main strengths is the location right in the middle of Gran Via which is one of the main arteries in the city centre. The staff was friendly especially Merit, a young intern who in spite of her young age managed my check in very smoothly, giving me the necessary information regarding my stay and most importantly she managed to make me feel like a human being and not just a room number. Keep up the good work! Hotel room seemed a bit small though double bed for single use, still everything worked, free wi-fi, well maintained furniture, flat screen, and very comfortable bed. Bathroom overall satisfying and kept consistently clean throughout my stay. Welcoming lobby though a bit of style confusion. The hotel is not meant to give you a wow effect as some boutique hotels would do but it's main force lies in the comfort it provides in many ways as well being in the middle of a great city like Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Location of the hotel is very good”
Reviews.Author: p k
Reviews.Content: As always, I will stay at the hotel, where is located in the city centre. This is the one. You just walk for 5 minutes then you will reach to shopping malls, restaurants, and walking street. There are both brand name shops andd local brand shops. Hotel reception who checked me in (afternoon shift) is very nice, good service and try to help. Morning ship - a lady does not sincere. I asked a question to get help, never think but say NO immediately. Ha ha I know the answer before as I got from the girl who checked me in I just want to see that she will give me the same or not. Fianlly it is not. Beside that bad service of a girl, the others are very good such as wifi in room, room decor, unique elevator, breakfast, and ofcourse location. I think I will come abck and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many "minus" points for a 4star...”
Reviews.Author: ABelgianFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple over a weekend in October 2011. Obviously, the location is stellar. Getting here from the airport requires changing trains twice. As such, in terms of interior, the hotel has everything you would expect (with free internet access in the lobby and wifi throughout). And yet, three points we encountered are of a nature not to be able to recommend this hotel without the following reservations: 1. A week in advance, we had written to ask for a quiet room with a double bed, i.e. not two singles. This email was replied within 24 hours indicating that they would attempt to do this. Upon arrival (Friday night around 10pm) the receptionist - not in the slightest aware of this request - informed us there were no rooms available with a double bed and that we should have come earlier. Our complaint that this was the very reason why we had written in advance was met by a rather indifferent attitude. They suggested we could "ourselves" try to put the two beds for one person together...In the end, a staff member of theirs came to do it. The next day, we were moved to a room which did have the bed type requested. While in the end they did seek a solution, it was clear we were considered a nuisance for pushing this point. 2. The most significant drawback is the breakfast room. It is manifestly too small to handle the amount of guests. Result: you have to queue both to get a table and to get your food (at some point it was 5 minutes to fill up on coffee...). As such, no complaints about the breakfast buffet which has the choice one could expect of a 4 star. Staff was a bit slow though when it comes to refilling items, even after having been pointed out that item X was missing. 3. Noise: while we had been given (as requested) a room facing the interior of the building, noise isolation of the rooms is pretty poor. So while in your bed, you do hear people passing through the corridor... Overall: this is definitely a 3 star, but it lacks some of the elements to make it a solid 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NikkiClaire
Reviews.Content: Ideally located on the Gran Via - close to the metro (only €2.50 to get from the airport to the hotel) and in walking distance of all the great sites! Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean, comfortable with modern decor. Lots of choice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “June 2011”
Reviews.Author: paddyinmexico
Reviews.Content: Very well located property,however the service was not up to par and the rooms are not good value and tiny. Thre was a construction project there which did not enhance the stay. NH on the Plaza del Sol would have been a better choice. The electronic key lock kept changing which required us to return to the lobby for a new code and when we drew it to the attention of the staff we were told it was our"fault" as no other guests had this problem. The type of response I would expect from Basil Fawlty.

Reviews.Title: “very good location-nothing to rave about but solid”
Reviews.Author: ripandburn
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night only.hotel is right next to a few plazas suitable for tourists and has decent restuarants and bars and cash machines etc. the front of the hotel is being renovated- which doesnt make it look appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Soxgirl58
Reviews.Content: Terrific location on Gran Via, close to restaurants, shopping, plazas, sights, transportation - everything we wanted. Room was smallish but well furnished with chic, elegant decor, very comfortable bed (although on odd wheels which tend to move). Nice bath with spacious separate dressing area a big plus. Our room on the 2nd floor (#202) had a small balcony, faced busy Gran Via and was unbelievably quiet -- absolutely no street noise. Didn't try hotel breakfast, prefer to get out and find little cafes, which are plentiful. Nice lobby bar with snacks. Staff spoke excellent English (not always the case in Madrid) and were extremely helpful and resourceful when we had a travel problem. A terrific experience and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Anneandfamily
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 5 nights here with my husband and son. We stayed in a triple exterior room overlooking a side street. The room was a bit small (but to be expected in the city centre) but very clean and well decorated. We had a mini bar which was reasonably priced (although we didn't use it) and a nice bathroom, although the shower was a bit old, but it worked ok. We had breakfast included in our rate, which was excellent. Very good choice and pleasant staff. The bar in reception was also good. Very reasonably priced for a hotel and again very pleasant staff. The hotel was central to everything for getting about. We did use the Metro and this was reasonable (1E for a journey) but also walked and it was easy to get around, although hot whilst we were there, but to be expected. Madrid is a beautiful city, very clean and lovely architecture. We all enjoyed it very much and would return. The only drawback was that a lot of the museums were closed during our stay for refurbishment. So check that out before you intend to visit any!! Some are also closed on Mondays!! We found eating out quite reasonable as well for a city. The air con in the room was good, although I would have to agree it was a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy hotel, service very good”
Reviews.Author: privacydenied
Reviews.Content: I've been in Madrid for 2 days and I really appreciated staying in Villa de la Reina. Nice hotel, full of comforts and very close to the centre of Madrid. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nairb1
Reviews.Content: Great location on Gran Via. Lots of interesting stuff within walking distance. Hotel was undergoing major refurb on the outside, so was glad of a quiet location. Was a very nice, but very small room. Bed was tiny(or cosy) for 2 persons. Breakfast was very plentiful, lots of choice both hot and cold. Friendly staff also. Ismael on reception deserves a mention. Was helpful beyond what u would normally expect. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ntransit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in late May 2011 and were not at all disappointed with our choice. The hotel is very modern and well maintained. (Yes, there was construction underway on the outside front of the hotel, but that did not impact our stay in any way.) Our room (a triple) was surprisingly large with quality furnishings and comfortable beds. There were large closets (with a free in-room safe), a nice desk, and a flat screen TV with 3 or 4 English channels. Free wi-fi was also available. (There were also 2 computers with internet access and a printer available for complimentary use in the hotel lobby.) The bathroom was quite spacious also, with a shower/tub combo toilet, and bidet. The breakfast buffet selection was extensive, and all the food of high quality, with lots of fresh fruits, meats, breads, and pastries. The staff were all professional and friendly. All of the front-desk staff spoke excellent English. (I would agree with an earlier post that English does not seem to be as widely spoken in Madrid as compared to other major European cities.) The location of the hotel is right on the Gran Via. (Note despite its location, our room was very quiet, with minimal noise during the sleeping hours.) A Metro station is just a 2-minute walk away. I was extremely satisfied with the H10 Villa de la Reina and will, without a doubt, stay here again on a future visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: lugaresqueconozco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at H10 Villa de la Reina after a long trip from Johannesburg. I like this hotel because its location is very close to all main attractions at madrid´s downtown.The flight arrived 6 am. I knew the check in time was 3 pm but I asked when I did the reservation to consider my arrival time and try to give me a roon as soon as they could. My flight arrived earlier and I was convinced I will be waiting at least until noon to be at my room. So,When I arrived the reservation list had a note to give me the room inmediatly. I was at my room at 7 am taking a shower an not only that, I had a fruit plate prepared waiting for an early snack.This kind of details exceeds the costumer expectations and makes him happy. Thanks to H10 Villa de la Reina. SUPERB SERVICE

Reviews.Title: “NYC to Madrid Quick Getaway w/ Great Hotel Exp.”
Reviews.Author: robNYCny
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 5 nights at H10 Villa in late April and had a great experience. The hotel is ideally situated on the Gran Via, literally one block from the Metro. The staff is friendly, helpful, accommodating and everyone we dealt with spoke excellent English (not always common in Madrid). The room was small but not too small; the bathroom was quite large; and the balcony more than made up for the room size. Room and other pics on their website are accurate. Free WiFi was readily available without interruption and it was speedy. If you're looking for a great, inexpensive hotel in the center of Madrid, H10 is a solid choice. About us: New Yorker's, Gay, Mid-30's, travel 3-4 times a year. Note: we requested by email the double room with a balcony 10 days in advance of our stay and they replied with confirmation quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on the noisy Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: Kendo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights 25-29 March - good central hotel,no nonsesne good travellers base, comfortable and clean, as you'd expect. Good sized room but traffic noise from the street particularly on the friday night was a minus - also plumbing/shower noise from adjacent rooms. That being said the central location was very handy, bang on the Gran Via (thus the noise). Staff generally helpful and friendly altho the staff in the (cramped) breakfast room were a bit more gruff. We got a good prioce direct from the hotel website and would certain;ly consider staying agian on a return trip. Fisrt time in Madrid and it was excellent city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but careful with room choice”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: Good value, good hotel, good location - but read more below about room allocation and choice. Location is excellent, right on Gran Via and opposite metro. Very clean, well serviced, and staff were mixed - some friendly, others not. Also very good value - we got a mid week room for 90 euros, thats only a few more euros than some of the 3 star hostals so exceptionally good value. Internet was fine too (contary to some reviewers). Only negative/advice (similar to other reviews) is to be careful which rooms you are allocated/choose. If you book a standard double then the rooms are adequate size (not tiny, not massive) but there are two types. The first (and the one we were first allocated was a interior room overlooking a covered small courtyard). It had windows, but essentially onto an interior area. The room was very hot (it was only 8 degrees outside!) and had no air at all and they'd set all aircon to heat only due to it being winter. So if you are one of those people who hates air, closes every window, and puts the heating on max then this is the room for you. Prob OK if we were there 1 or 2 nights but we were staying 5. Benefit of the room is it was quiet. However, it was too stuffy for us so we asked to move. They were full that night (Madrid fashion week) and we never asked until later in the day so they kindly moved us the following day to a room overlooking Gran Via (the main road). It was airy and much more comfortable (although same size, etc) but just what we wanted - we just wanted fresh air. Note because they are on the main road these rooms will be noisier. So my advice is if you book a normal double then make sure its an exterior room on check in, or alternatively book a superior which are slightly larger. However, the standard was great for us, once we were on the exterior. Breakfast is nice enough - if included, 10 euros pp if not. Overall great location, good value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Merllinn
Reviews.Content: Just look at the address of this hotel, that should be enough to see it is in the very city center. It is 200 m walk from Gran Via underground station. The standard rooms are small but very clean, the bathrooms have bathtub and are very clean as well. Beds are comfortable but seemed to have been easily moving like they were on small wheels. Internet is free in the room and we had a good connection, no problems at all about it. If you need space or more air please book superior type of rooms and make sure you don't get one facing the inner patio-like area. Breakfast was very good and rich for a city hotel, I loved it. This is a good 4 star hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2010”
Reviews.Author: sockman2
Reviews.Content: Due to the snow our arrival at the hotel was delayed by three days and when we did eventually arrive at the hotel at about 8pm very tired we found the reception staff very unhelpful and unwilling to give us our room dispite the fact we were fully paid for the entire stay!!. He did eventually give in to us and give us a room but we had booked a queen bedded room and he chose to give us a cheaper room instead and said the other we had booked was not available, this was a horrible way to start our xmas holiday break that we had spent all year planning. The Hotel advertises free wireless internet in the bedrooms but on our arrival it was not working and throughout our stay was barely useable. We booked a room that included buffet breakfast and were not disapointed there was a very good selection and topped up regularly the problem we found was that they request you wait to be seated which we did but the staff were almost every day at different times we arrived in the kitchen busy talking and not payng attention to seating guests at all. We also found that the staff whilst they understand English are unwilling to converse with customers in any othe language other than spanish and that includes the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: tripdreamer1975
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Right on the Gran Via and a 3 min walk to the Metro station or a 10 min. walk to Puerta del Sol and most of the sites. The room was clean with all the needed amenities, but quite small for 2 persons. The internet connection was free but with a lot of issues troughout our stay (pity for an overall nice hotel). Breakfast was plentiful. In general, it was a good choice at the proper value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms below standard”
Reviews.Author: gertg1880271
Reviews.Content: Booked H10 with Bongo. Great location and staff but our room was below standard. We had a room at the first floor but our window couldn't close off fully so we had some noise from the street. Also the mattress was very hard. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large and clean room”
Reviews.Author: oga25
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Madrid to visit some family and spent 3 nights at this hotel. After reading the reviews I decided to book the superior room and I must admit I did the right choice. It is 25 Euro difference approximately per night with respect to the standard double, but the difference is definitely worth the money. The room was very large and had everything we needed: heath control, big flat screen TV, fridge, towels and bathroobes, internet connection etc. It was located on the first floor, above the lobby (room 202) with a bacony overlooking the Gran Via. The streets is very busy and noisy at all times of the day. You can hear police and ambulance sirens constantly, but when you have your windows closed, the noise is not much of a concern. The staff is friendy once they get to know you and you establish a good relationship with them. The servers do not work for the tip unlike in North America and they will not go out of their way to provide you with the best service ever, but if you are approachable and friendy they will make sure they make your stay very pleasant. The breakfast was great, excellent chouice of items for all tastes (5 different types of cheeses, hams, salami, sausages, beacon, eggs, mini sandwiches, pastries, and many many more). All the premises were very clean and new. The location is excellent. We never took the subway, as Madrid is not extremely spread around. You can walk everywhere and be in 20 minutes at Prado, Retiro park or Royal Palace or even Plaza Mayor and Mercato San Miguel. The area around the hotel is very popular for its restaurants and bars and it is always very busy and yet safe. You might see prostitutes on Calle de la Montera, which connects the hotel to Plaza del Sol, but at least in winter times you might not even know that they are actual prostitutes. These girls are all dressed normally and look like any other girl on the street. Calle de la Montera is very popular for shoe and handbag shopping but we found the quiality of shoes and bags to be very poor in general. Spain has lots of god quality leather, but Italy makes much better shoes. Restaurant prices are quite affordable if you eat where all locals eat. Many places have fixed menues for 10 euros where you can have 3 course meal, coffe/tea and 1 alcoholic drink (or more). Some places even offer unlimited tapas for 4 euros, but they tend to me overcrowded. Keep in mind Spanish people dine late so many restaurants migh not be open for dinner before 8:00 or 8:30 pm. I would definitely return to this hotel if I happen to visit Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “great for location, value and style”
Reviews.Author: colinpNorwich
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for three nights. First the only downside. Thanks to previous warnings on Tripadvisor we were braced for pickpockets, and sure enough there was an attempt on my wife`s handbag on the tube. We confronted the gang but because my wife had been very vigilant, they had in fact not been able to steal anything from her. Just be aware and keep valuables under zips. That said, we had a fantastic time in Madrid. Very easy on the tube from airport to the centre to Gran Via. 2 Euros fare. Hotel is very stylish, and we had a very good deal which included the most wonderful breakfast which set us up for the day (expensive if bought separately tho.) We were able to walk everywhere and were amazed at the beautiful buildings and large scale of everything. There is a very good range of restaurants and would recommend trip to Hard Rock cafe. Food generally very good choice and super value. The whole place comes alive at night, and the crowds have to be seen to be believed. Generally we found not much English spoken and customer service is not deemed to be important in many places. Two tips, get a good guide book, and if you dont like night noise, best take some airplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: GermanFreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for several days in that hotel for it offered w-lan in the room. But it was impossible to get an internet connection. The staff didn't do anything to solve the problem; they just said, we have an business center. I also tried to connect to the main office of the hotel chain - but their answer took a week and was, please use another adress to connect us. And unbelievable but true, almost half of the time, the staff at the reception desk was not able to communicate in English.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: bedouindubai
Reviews.Content: We were on the 2nd floor, and it was very noisy from the back street (busy bar/restaurant area) . That pretty much carried on till 6 am every morning during our stay (Thurs-Sun), so unless you are a heavy sleeper, or will be hitting the clubs until the early hours, maybe not your cup of tea. Great location though on Gran Via. Small but clean rooms. Didn't try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “UNCOMFORTABLE BEDS, STAFF WITH ATTITUDE”
Reviews.Author: Jory45
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed after reading other reviews. Great location but overpriced, ordinary small room, rock hard beds.No window , asked to be moved but just got attitude from the guy on front desk as though we were a real bother. Asked for information on nearby Hammam, he sneered and said he wouldn't know as "Spanish people wouldn't got there" ...which was funny as it was all Spanish folk except us! Breakfast fine except the nightclub rope fencing you off and waiting for the surly waitress....Really just overpriced and unwelcoming!

Reviews.Title: “very helpful”
Reviews.Author: hassodove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived by overnight train from Paris, we got to the Hotel at 10 am tired and in need of a shower, and the room was already waiting for us, this was a result, due to the general strike on the wednesday, our plans were really messed up, they cancelled one nights stay at no extra cost, and on checking out I left my credit card in their machine. Imagine my panic on discovering the loss, but a telephone call allayed my fears, and they posted it on for me, would recommend the hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for central Madrid hotel”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute on the hotels own web site and paid 79.00 euros B&B and a better room, excellent value. Hotel 2 mins walk from Gran Via metro station easy to find and also the metro is a great way to get from Madrid airport 2 euros each way with 2 changes. Rooms where great, large & modern and the breakfast had everything that you would expect. Walked everywhere never felt the need to take a bus, taxi or metro to see the sights. Go for it you won't be dissapointed ......

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance of most attractions”
Reviews.Author: lemans24
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel in the centre of madrid. The room was a triple - 2 single beds and a sofa bed which was very soft and comfy. There was a large flat screen tv with spanish channels, a fridge and a safe in the wardrobe, and a large bathroom with toilet, bidet, bath with shower over. The furnishings are all modern and good quality. The bar is in the reception area and is large and comfortable with spanish snacks on display. The hotel is spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. I would stay here again. The hotel is close to a couple of coffee shops and a McDonalds and is situated on Gran Via with the Gay area 10 minutes walk one way and the main shopping/tourist area 5 minutes walk the other way. Be warned the main road almost opposite Calle de la Montera is a bit of an eye opener, there are prostitutes here at all times of the day, so I advise ladies don't hang about here or you may be propositioned! But the shoe and handbag shops are in abundance on this street.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: Desertconnoisseur
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel just this week. Our room was large and had a view. As you can see from our photos, the room was impeccable, with cherry wood cabinets, and fixtures of the latest style. We found the service in the bar and the desk to be superb. The location could not be better, and we would go back in a heartbeat. Our room, number 202, was generous, even for American standards, and the small balcony overlooking the Gran Via was fun. There may be other rooms that are smaller and darker, as a previous reviewer indicated, but ours could not be better. I would agree that the beds on rollers are, however, a minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “A fine, well-priced and located hotel”
Reviews.Author: XYZABCBoston
Reviews.Content: Villa de la Reina is a good mid-priced choice in Madrid. it is comfortable, well-located and has good service. It i on the busy Gran Via, but the windows are effective at blocking out noise.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised...”
Reviews.Author: scrittib
Reviews.Content: Previous advisors have mentioned small rooms. Our room was a very small double bed in an-only-slightly-bigger-than-the-bed double room). Fortunately the reception staff reacted well and changed the room for subsequent nights. Even so the beds are rather flimsy (on wheels!) for a four star hotel. However, the staff were helpful, the location is good and the lobby one is of those places where you can watch the world go by. I think that you could do much worse in Madrid. The walk between Sol and the hotel is er, well, a bit naughty at night but not threatening.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Maddog43
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Madrid and I traveled with my wife and nine year old son. We picked the H10 Villa de la Reina because of the price and good reviews on TripAdvisor. I have traveled a lot all over the world and this hotel was outstanding. Very similar to a upscale Hampton Inn. The staff was very friendly and most spoke English well enough to help us with directions or suggestions of touring the city. We arrived at the hotel around 10am and were told the room wouldn't be ready for a few hours. Upon finding out that we were on the 1st floor (one above street level), we asked if we could have a room facing the Gran Via. The staff was initially reluctant because of the street noise (the road is always busy, think New York City). We told them the noise wouldn't bother us and so they reassigned our room. The windows kept out most noise and it never woke us up. We toured the city for a few hours and as promised, the room was ready. The room was spacious and very clean. The housekeeper kept the room clean for our five days. The bathroom amenities were very nice (shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, tooth brush, comb, etc). The shower pressure was up to US standards and the hot water was always available on demand. The hotel lounge was a nice touch each evening. Prices very reasonable. They didn't gouge. The front desk offered complimentary Cava each day from about noon on. The hotel offered breakfast which was included in our rate. They had pastries, cereal, fruit, cheeses, sliced meat, sausages, eggs, coffee and juices. Food was good and fresh. The hotel is centrally located on the Gran Via. It is located about 80 yards from the Gran Via metro stop. We only used the metro once and that was to go to the train station. All other times, we walked. Lonely Planet's recommendation for the best Sangria and Mojitos in Madrid are within 5 minute walk from the hotel. There was a whole in the wall pizza place two doors down that my son loved. It sold by the slice and was open until 7am. The only downside and this is very slight is you have people heading home from a night of drinking walking past all hours of the night (up to 6am). However, the windows kept most of the noise out and we are only talking about 30-50 people a night over a 6 hour spread. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BennyOnTour
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights here. Very close to Metro; walkable to Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, Prado. Interesting tapas bars on small streets north of Gran Via. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were well decorated, with all amenities (except soap dish). The breakfast is excellent, but expensive if you don't have the b & b rate. Will return if in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service & better location.”
Reviews.Author: FrankGonzalez
Reviews.Content: I've been several times in this hotel. I used to go by AVE and is just 4 stops of underground, GRAN VIA. Locations is in city center and well connected with everything, I prefer use "Metro" and also is close to SoL square. Rooms are correct and clean, but I love the service and enjoy a beer in the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: EH02holiday
Reviews.Content: Staff are helpful and the hotel is in a fairly good location, you can get the train from the airport to the hotel very easily and that probably save a bit on taxi, so if you factor that in, it's a good option as taxi isn't cheap. Yes there are better hotels out there in a better location and bigger room (room in H10 is tiny) but you get what you pay for. If you need facilities such as gym, indoor swimming pool etc, don't stay there, but if you are seeking a short 1 or 2 nights in madrid with a budget, then H10 is okay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vroom9
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, friendly and helpful staff, brilliant location. can be a bit noisy if you get a room overlooking gran via, but it is worth it for the hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: 1951art
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights in Madrid as a long weekend booking through Lastminute. We had read on Tripadvisor that joining the H10 club online would be a good idea and so it proved. We arrived at about 3pm and were cordially welcomed and given our keys to a basic double room on the top floor (605). We initially thought it must have been an upgrade as the room was perfect, and the later arrival of white dressing gowns and slippers along with an invitation to a free drink at the bar sort of confirmed this despite the young lady at reception assuring us this was as booked. Lovely bathroom and new flatscreen TV etc. Very quiet despite being on the Grand Via as the room opens onto an internal lightwell rather than the road - a bit disorienting this as it was a glass roofed lightwell and we had little idea of how dull/bright it was outside until we went downstairs. The reception staff were most helpful, looking up suitable restaurants/ flamenco on the internet and printing out relevant maps etc. The Prado and Reine Sofia galleries were a pleasant walk away and the metro was 100yds left from the front door. We didnt try the breakfasts are there are plenty of small authentic restaurants in the area. A really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a fantastically alive city”
Reviews.Author: MonoUK
Reviews.Content: We went for Orgullo Gay (Gay Pride) knowing full well that the activities around Chueca and Gran Vía would mean that the parties in the streets and plazas would run well into the early hours each night. Although very conveniently placed to get into Chueca and to see the parade pass the front doors, the internal room was an oasis of calm affording almost total quiet – even with the window open (sometimes aircon isn't the right kind of cool). The staff were friendly and the building absolutely spotless throughout our visit and the room was stylishly functional.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms vary enormously”
Reviews.Author: LizH2London
Reviews.Content: This is a good clean, very central hotel. But the rooms are of wildly differant sizes and quality. We were initially put in to a room the size of a rabbit hutch with absolutely no natural light. Worse than a poor Travelodge. I immediately asked for another and this time our room was larger, brighter but was on the first floor of the building overlooking the Grand Via - which is a cacophany of noise from dawn to dusk. After two nights of zero sleep I asked to see the manager, put my foot down very firmly, and we were moved to a lovely room, huge, quiet and with its own private terrace. Lesson is - if you're not happy, asked to be moved. There is better there. And ask to speak to the organ grinder - some of the staff on Reception are pretty practiced at the brush off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - best part of staying at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelcava
Reviews.Content: Pictures are a little misleading, rooms are small and beds are hard. Seems to be the norm for Madrid. Bathroom is nice and clean and well appointed. The hotel is clean and maid service is attentive. The hotel staff has mixed reviews. There is one Staff member that seems to always be rude - all others friendly and helpful! Air conditioning in Spain is a huge plus and this hotel has good a/c. It is very hot in the summer months. We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel because there are so many wonderful restuarants and cafe's in walking distance. In fact this hotel is on Gran Via (very busy area) but rooms are quiet and peaceful. Tiny business center. Internet hot and cold. Seems to work sometimes and other times not so good. The best part of this hotel is the location, location, location. Metro close by and walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace, Prado Museum and many other great sights!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, CourteousStaff, To be recommended.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSoloTraveller
Reviews.Content: Solo traveller, v.helpful staff, quiet hotel, room fine for one, bathroom excellent. For me...10/10. Certainly intend to return.,

Reviews.Title: “Had an Excellent time at Villa de la Reina!”
Reviews.Author: LilLinda
Reviews.Content: We spent seven wonderful nights at H10 Villa de la Reina. We had wanted a comfortable hotel in the 80-90 Euro range, and this surpassed our expectations. From the moment we arrived (and were allowed to check-in two hours early), we knew we had chosen the right location for our family. The hotel staff we came into contact with was extremely helpful and courteous. The front desk staff was always available to answer our many questions, the housekeepers were very thorough, the maintenance man (whose name unfortunately escapes us) quickly brought us another TV and remote control when ours were not working, and the restaurant staff prepared a delicious breakfast. We had a clean, pretty, double room on the fourth floor overlooking Gran Via. Lots of traffic, but with the balcony doors closed, we couldn't hear it. We also traveled with our infant son and felt he was especially cared for by the staff at Villa de la Reina. The crib and bed linens were new and changed twice while we were there. He even had his own very cute bath towels! Overall, we had a wonderful time in Madrid and would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a superb location within walking distance of the metro and many eating and shopping establishments. For a great time, do not hesitate to stay at H10 Villa de la Reina! –Happy guests from California, USA

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: akapaf
Reviews.Content: the H10 Villa de la Reina is a nice hotel, completely renewed, with a good service and nice rooms, in a very good position for any need you may have in Madrid. The room I got was clean and perfectly appointed, even if a little too small. The bed in particular was smaller than a normal queen size, which was good enough for me, but two people would have been not so comfortable, I guess. Anyway, I'd suggest this hotel to anybody and I'll probably be there again next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseWzy
Reviews.Content: The Villa de la Reina's rooms are very contemporary, updated and clean. I loved the combo closet, drawers and mini bar system that allowed all of my personal items to be located together for convenience. The pictures that are shown on the website are exactly as the rooms look. The single, had a double bed and the daily fresh towels and linens were very much appreciated. I had a room at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. There are less than 10 rooms per section on each floor so the noise from other guests is really minimal. The hotel bar served food and drinks so I never used room service. I could grab a cup of tea or a snack nearly any time I wanted. The restaurant's breakfast was 16 euros and worth it if you want to have a good meal before heading out for a day of sightseeing. There was a large assortment of items to choose from and I wished I had known about the restaurant earlier in my stay. The business center is a desk with 2 computers in a corner of the lobby and it was nice to be able to check e-mail, plan a day trip or check the Dodger's scores. The staff was very quick and helpful whether I needed an iron, directions to the Metro station or suggestions on a neighborhood restaurant. The wait staff at the bar/cafe and restaurant were just a pleasant and helpful with menu recommendations. I had no trouble communicating with my limited Spanish and there is always someone at the reception area that speaks English fluently. The location was ideal for this first-time Madrid visitor as the hotel is on Gran Via and was central to everything that I wanted to visit. I could walk nearly everywhere and there is a Metro station entrance one block away. I felt safe in the neighborhood and anything I wanted (food, shopping, pharmacy, banks, etc.) is nearby. I am looking forward to visiting another H10 property (maybe Rome!) soon. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gydko
Reviews.Content: The old elevator is a true gem, even if some patience is required. Rooms are clean and spacious, and this is a charming classical building. Location is superb for chueca restaurants & nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, value and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: seamusgw
Reviews.Content: - stayed for four nights leisure trip, we had two rooms, both twin rooms were small particularly ours.....kept bumping into one another moving around...but had a large well equipped bathroom, great shower and loads of hot water....rooms were comfortable, very clean, beds were fine, air conditioning worked a treat and there was no noise...room was not facing street but could hear no noise anywhere in hotel...has a quirky old style lift The hotel is located on Gran Via, < 5 minswalk from metro stop, very central, c 30 min quick walk in any direction covers all the main central Madrid sights......hotel was great value, booked on hotels web-site c.€55 per person per night sharing a twin room with breakfast included.....breakfast was very good a full buffet with fruit, cold meats, pastries cereals, juices, and english options.....enough for a full day sight-seeing......staff were friendly and check-in and out took a couple of minutes....free internet in lobby...nice cool bar area to rest and browse papers.......area around the hotel is fine with shops and hotels by day ...changes a bit by night with street vendors and girls walking the street but we all felt very safe no matter how late we were.....the district behind the hotel leads to lots of tapas bars and night life and alterantive types hang out here..... Overall given the not so positive reviews for so many other hotels in Madrid we were delighted with this choice and would definately return again...recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “How do you switch off the airco?”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the city centre. Rooms are nicely decorated. However I could not find the switch for the airconditioning, so it was very cold in the room at nightt. Staff was friendly as my reservation was not there when I tried to check in. Got the last available room....

Reviews.Title: “Chic, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: _love_04
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely situated in Gran Via, a central location of Madrid. There were many nearby restaurants and places to eat. The hotel itself was nicely accomodated. Our room included a mini bar. In our stay we did not hear any noise, quiet enough to sleep soundly. Very clean. Staff was extremely kind and helped us with all kinds of information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: monkeystar861
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a few days sightseeing - we took tube train from airport to very close to the hotel and found the hotel really easy to find - everyone knows where gran via is which is one of the main streets in madrid so just ask for gran via - pronounced gran bia! - and you will find your bearings! Rooms were very clean and modern decor - nice glass sinks etc and mini bar - staff are super helpful - check out el chaflan restaurant wise for a treat - lots of room, only a handful of tables and food is exquisite - try the roast suckling pig.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ZBenk
Reviews.Content: After many days spent searching for a suitable hotel that could accomodate a group of 10 people, we found 5 small double rooms at 90Euros each on booking.com at H10. Given the central location and the star rating of the hotel, we immediately placed our bets on H10. Upon arrival, the hotel staff was extremely courteous, friendly, and accomodating. The hotel lobby was very nice and included modern decor with complimentary champagne in the evenings. The lobby area also included two free computers with a printer for its guests' use. I would highly recommend this hotel given the price we found. The only complaint I have is that my room was quite small and faced a small, noisy street as opposed to the rooms of my friends that were larger and faced Gran Via (they didn't experience any noise). Further, our room faced a building undergoing construction, so I was rudely awakened on Friday morning by the sound of banging. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's cleanliness, friendliness of staff, central location, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Happy Happy”
Reviews.Author: ChurroLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this stay via Lastminute.com, purely on the basis of reviews that I read here. My primary concerns were cleanliness and the distance from the main tourist sites. Everything I wanted to see was within 15 mins walk of the hotel. 30 mins from the airport, 1 minute from the Gran Via Tube. V easy to find. Greeted courteously. I had booked a small double, but asked for and got a twin with a view. The room was a very decent size, facing the street. V. clean! Air con worked perfectly. Clean bright room. The glazing was really effective in keeping the noise from the street below at bay ( the hotel is on the equivalent of London's Oxford St, so quite noisy). Next morning we went to the restaurant for a buffet style breakfast. As you would expect it was dearer than a cafe ( we had booked a room only basis so it cost €16 each). Still, the menu was extensive: pastries, full english, fruit, juice, tea and coffee and yoghurt, all of good standard are available there, but not the churros and chocolate, which is a Spanish speciality ( go to Calle San Gines for that "treat"). H10 passed the customer service test when room service delivered the wrong food to our room. The correction was made without any fuss or argument, and we received an apology which defused what might have become a tense situation. In a perfect stay I do add one caveat. If like me you value peace and quiet please note: at present during the week there is building work in progress next door to H10 (Aug 2008). On the final day of our stay (a Monday) , incessant banging started at roughly 7am. By 8am we got up because we could not take it any longer, and guests in other rooms had begun banging back in response. This is the only gripe, but if you going for a midweek break it is relevant. Madrid life means people sleep in and stay up late at night! It may be different if you are situated at the back of the hotel. That said I would definitely use the H10 again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Overstone
Reviews.Content: While I was staying in Madrid I experienced what a taxi driver told me was the hottest day for over ten years - 39C (102F). Thankfully the Villa de la Reina was a cool oasis to return to in the blistering heat of the afternoon. My good-sized twin room was on a light well, so very quiet though a bit gloomy, but that was a positive advantage in the height of summer. The air conditioning was easy to operate and the shower in the spacious bathroom worked a treat on every occasion I used it to cool down. The public areas are mostly very good with the roomy hotel lobby looking sophisticated and comfortable at the same time with a bar that sold very good coffee if like me you don't drink much alcohol. The only downside to the hotel was that the corridors looked rather shabby and could do with a bit of a make-over. Also in the lobby are two free computers along with a printer for guests to use, very handy for printing off new flight details when I decided to prolong my stay. The staff was absolutely lovely with very sweet and friendly girls on reception and although I experienced no problems whatsoever, I got the feeling the staff would have bent over backwards to help if I had. As the heat acts as a kind of appetite suppressant with me I skipped the hotel's breakfast in favour of a large cocktail of fresh fruit at Vitamine, the excellent juice bar just a few doors away, so cannot comment on the food. The mini bar in my room was reasonably priced with bottles of water (so essential in the heat) actually cheaper than those on sale in the street outside. This hotel is situated on the Gran Via and many tourist hot spots such as the main museums, royal palace, botanical gardens and Retiro Park are all within easy walking distance. The Gran Via itself is full of good shops (the sales were on while I was there) and has several theatres and cinemas. All is fine during the day but at night when the shutters come down on the smart shops the place becomes transformed as they are without exception covered in graffiti (a problem everywhere in Madrid though) and the prostitutes that hang out in the back streets, venture out onto the Via. I never felt threatened, but it isn't pleasant, the night time security at the hotel appeared to be very good though. There are quite a number of hotels on the Gran Via that all looked very smart, but I was pleased with my choice of the Villa de la Reina and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting Madrid.
