Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a fantastic location. We stayed here for two nights in March and the place was clean, modern, and very comfortable. The free wireless internet was a big plus. We really enjoyed the large breakfast- big variety and a great way to start the day. Although the room was on the small side- we didn't really mind because we were out and about for most of the time. For restaurants nearby- we hightly recomend Extremadura, located at Calle Libertad 13. Great food at good value and very likable staff. We had the veal with mushroom sauce and it was great! They have and English menu and the servers are very nice. Definitely not a tourist place, but a genuine Spanish experience that is super close to the Gran Via. Here is a link with more info: http://travel.nytimes.com/travel/guides/europe/spain/madrid/restaurant-detail.html?vid=1154654631492

Reviews.Title: “Solid three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: teppy83
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel in mid 2006 I can remember very little that stood out about the place. The decor is modern and in good shape, the rooms are a touch small but well equipped and the breakfast was reasonable for the price. The reception staff stood out as being particularly helpful and friendly, though on the flip-side my room suffered heavily from street noise and I was woken most mornings at 4:30am by garbage trucks. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne-Cantle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Villa de le Reina in August 2007 for three nights. We had looked at the hotel on the internet and had read previous reviews, the hotel was as discribed. LOCATION Well located on the Gran Via, close to the shops, restaurants and bars and only a one minute wallk from the Gran Via metro station (ten metro trips €6. RECEPTION Hotel reception staff friendly and helpful. Were were given a map of the city and metro. There were no problems at check in and our room was ready. ROOMS As per previous reviews, small but modern and extremely clean. Bathroom was enormous and lots of little extras such as toothbrushes, razor etc. Only downside to our room was that we didnt have an external window, so no natural light. Not ideal if you are claustrophobic. BREAKFAST Neat little room with lots of choice, cooked, fruit, pastries, cereal, meats, cheeses and even sandwiches. HOTEL BAR Quiet expensive but again good service. Overall a great hotel for a city break. Perfectly situated and great service. It was fairly quiet in August, we suspect due to the 40 degree heat. We would recommend a visit to the Parque de Retiro (hire a boat on the lake €4.30 for 45 minutes), a trip on Madrid Vision tour bus, a great way to get around in the searing heat and eat at Garbo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: caz126
Reviews.Content: We stayed at H10 Villa De La Reina for 2 nights for my birthday this year. It was located on the Grand Via which is central for shopping. The room was situated on the first floor and was surprisingly incredibly spacious. The decor was pleasant and the bathroom was very clean. I would recommend this to anyone wishing to stay in a nice and conveniently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a Madrid gem”
Reviews.Author: EANYC
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through venere.com, an excellent Italian site that does not oblige one to pre-pay. This was my fifth stay at this four-star property, and my most recent stay was as gratifying as my first one. The hotel is ideally located just north of the intersection of Calle Alcalá and Gran Vía, making it easy to walk to the museums (Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza), to the old city beyond the Purta del Sol, the high-end shopping on Serrano in Salamanca, and the restaurant scene in the Chueca. The property has been thoroughly refurbished with all modern amenities. Both guest rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well-equipped. For those who do not wish to avail themselves of the free wireless access in guest rooms, there are two free computer terminals with broadband access and laser printers in the hotel lobby. Breakfast is excellent and my only request here would be to open the lobby bar a little earlier than 9am so that one could have a cup of coffee if one is not a breakfast person. The staff is courteous and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “central location, great breakfast, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: pza
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for 4 nights. Rooms are a bit too small but our bathroom was big. Breakfast was very good and staff very helpful. Within walking distance to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: monacal
Reviews.Content: Villa de la Reina is a refurbished hotel on Gran Via, very centrally located. The rooms tend to be on the smallish size, but ours was compensated by a nice and large bathroom. We had a room facing the street and were surprised by the excellent insulation from the noise below. Interior rooms may feel a bit dark and stuffy, but that is my guess. The rooms decor is modern although the building has the patina and charm of past eras. Altogether it is an elegant hotel in a minor key. Access to the rooms of this tall and narrow building is through two elevators: one modern and one early 20th century--rather charming. There is free access to two internet stations. Breakfast and other eating facilities are available but were not included in the price of accommodation. Staff wa courteous and friendly. This is a reasonably priced place ; its main virtue is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: KillBill
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Our room was quite big by European standards, we had our own little courtyard as well (it was way too hot to stay out there though!). We had a problem with our air-con unit, and within about 10 mins they had sent someone up to check it out. It was fixed in seconds... (it was most likely our fault) The room and bathroom were clean (our room had bathroom scales!). We had two chairs and a little table in the room and space for our suitcases. The hotel scored extra points with us as there was a fashion magazine in the room for us to read! The breakfast was great - fresh pot of coffee, eggs, bacon, pastries, toast, fresh fruit etc. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and the reception staff were very helpful and spoke good English as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Paddyfieldluzern
Reviews.Content: This is a very average hotel - rooms are very small, wall paper peeling off walls, tiny bathrooms, strange half curtains, aircon only works when key is installed in room - not good in the Madrid heat. The rates are good but I am sure you can get much beter value in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you Don't get a room overlooking the square!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of the day having arrived after a long flight from Hong Kong. We were given a first floor room overlooking the square. It looked delightful with the sun shining over the plaza. Dog tired - we decided to get some sleep. Then the party goers arrived outside! The noise level rose steadily through the night - teenagers camped out in the square boozing, shouting and screaming - just a few metres just outside our room. Amazingly, there was no double glazing! There is an underground car park under the square - traffic jams built up and the drivers all responded by blowing their horns just 1-2 metres below our room. Several drunks then threw up - with considerable gusto just outside! We thought there might be some respite come 5.00 am - but no, then came the refuse trucks, the banging bins - the whole shebang! I could not believe the management had not installed double glazing! We complained to the front desk - it was quite apparent that the had received complaints every morning for, well, perhaps YEARS!! They did respond though and gave us an alternative room facing an interior courtyard which was much, much better, but I did feel they took advantage us - they clearly thought that we, coming from Hong Kong, would probably not have forseen the noise problem and possibly would not complain about it. If you book an inward facing room this is a very nice hotel - but be warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just fininshed staying five nights at the Villa de la Reina. I found it to be a very good value for the price. The room was small (no sitting area), but the bathroom and the bed were large. The room and bathroom were clean and modern. When I first arrived, there was not a bathrobe as advertised. When I returned in the evening, the bed was turned down, and the maid left a bathrobe, slippers and additional bathroom items (realizing I was a women). The breakfast, included in the price, had a large selection of fresh fruit, breads, meats and cereals. The hotel was centrally located and convenient. My room faced the back, but was still sunny and very quiet. The price ranged between 85 euros to 130 euros a night (depending on the night) and a very good value for the room, services, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: Juan45
Reviews.Content: Quite good in general - my only reservation would be the size of the room. A little tight, to say the least, but fresh and well furnished. Our room overlooked a quiet side street, and had good light-proof curtains, so we slept well. Everything was very clean. I agree with the other reviewer about the breakfast room being in the basement, which is a little odd, but the breakfasts were fairly good - plenty of fresh fruit. Bacon crispy one day, soggy the next! Don't leave it too late getting down to breakfast as they tended to run out of things and not replace them. The bar is well run and has a good range of reasonably priced wine and cocktails. Shame it shuts early, but maybe they don't get enough demand to keep it running. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, and the location is as good as it gets. I'd certainly stay there again. One tip - if you arrive by taxi remember the street location of the hotel (11 Gran Via). Our driver didn't have a clue where it was when we asked for it by name.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: I have just been at the H10 Villa de la reina. I paid 107 Euros for 2 people and, for this price, ia a very good hotel. The location is quite good, but if you have a room facing the Gran Vía you will have problems with the noise ( but you will have this problem in all hotels in Gran Vía ). The breakfast is good, really good including a very good coffee, which is very rare in a hotel breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sardaz
Reviews.Content: Just come back from staying at the Villa de La Reina in the Gran Via and loved it. The hotel sits on the main(Gran) road(Via)in Madrid which gets very busy but we didn't notice the noise from our rooms as the windows are double glazed. The room was clean, tidy and modern, the mini bar was reasonable priced and there was plenty of storage. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were soft and firm - not blocks of cement! The bathroom had marble walls with a bath and a power shower (very powerful!) with endless hot water. Again very clean and with all sorts of complimentary toiletries from cologne to shaving kits - no bathrobe as advertised. The staff were very helpful and polite. The breakfast is a buffet with a good choice of food including english bacon(not crispy), spanish ham, fruit, pastries, cheeses, salmon, etc. Hot drinks in the lounge area come with pastries. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would certainly go back. Found no faults and it certainly deserves its 4 star status. I also organised transfers (on the internet) from and to the airport with World Airport Transfer and wasn't disapointed with the service, it was clean, prompt and good value, plus you can see the some of the sites/hotels on your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daoshaug
Reviews.Content: Overall, a most enjoyable stay at the Hotel; terrific value for money ( €113.00 per room per night) and well located for access to the key tourist attractions in Madrid. Breakfast was included in the price and was excellent. The bus stop for the "open top" tourist bus was just across the street from the hotel which was very convenient. The staff throughout the hotel - dining room, reception and bar - were most helpful. In terms of the "downsides", we had booked a double room and found ourselves in a "twin" room; we did ask if the two beds could be joined into one but couldn't be done. Also, the bar in the hotel closes at midnight sharp so don't expect to be able to get a "night-cap" if you get back to the hotel after midnight!! Nonetheless, would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaninePaprota
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend and had a really nice time. I went with my boyfriend and we found the hotel staff to be really helpful and really friendly. Our room was exactly as the pictures look. They The rooms were faultless. The cleaners came to tidy the room everyday and they even left us some tapas one evening.. The hotel is ideally located on the Gran Via (with excellent shopping) and close to the Puerta Del Sol. It was perfect being so central. Whilst in Madrid we went to watch the football...it was well worth the visit seeing the stadium etc. Try Larios restaurant just off the Gran Via...nice food and friendly staff. It's a restaurant and bar so perfect for a night out.

Reviews.Title: “As described!”
Reviews.Author: Theglobtrotter
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after staying in a H10 hotel in Barcelona. The hotel was as we expected it to be, clean and good service from the staff. This hotel is located on one of Madrid's busiest roads however this did not disturb us a we had a room towards the back of the hotel unfortunately we did not have a view from our room as it overlooked a small court yard but I would rather have the peace and quite to sleep than a view - not that there was much to see. Overall we were pleased with the hotel even though the temperature in our room felt like mid summer instead of December. The location was great, within walking distance to the metro (10m approx ) and we would stay in a H10 hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -- reviews are right”
Reviews.Author: yorkistrose
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with a hotel room in Europe but it was a far better one than I'd expected. Staff was pleasant if not super helpful (pretty much like any standard American service at a Holiday Inn or Hampton). Although I had to wait for my room (I arrived at 1:30 pm) when I got in it was spotlessly clean and nicely furnished. Room was small and faced the inner courtyard but you could open the windows for air and we were insulated from the noise. I thought the rate was very reasonable (89 euro for a double) and the location was very convenient -- close enough to walk to Plaza Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, the "big 3" museums, even Palacio Real. I'd have no problems staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have spent more than twice as much to stay in hotels that weren't half as nice as the Villa De La Reina. Our room was on the second floor and was one of the two rooms with a large street side balcony (other rooms have balconies but they were much smaller). Friends of ours that use to live in Madrid recomended this hotel and stay here when they visit Madrid. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very central”
Reviews.Author: hendrixfans
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after having read a lot of reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed with our choice. The location could not have been better. The hotel staff were efficient and very pleasant. We had requested a double room but got twins on arrival. When we asked about this, they said they did have a double and we would be welcome to it, but it was an 'inner' room with no view so we opted for the twin room overlooking the Gran Via. The double glazing was very good and kept most of the noise out, but bear in mind Madrid is a noisy place and Gran Via is a main road so it is busy all day and all night long. Our room and bathroom were very clean and better than a lot we have stayed in around the world which have cost a lot more. The breakfast was really good, better than we had expected or hoped. There was everything from fresh fruit to the full English, ham rolls, cheeses and they even had Soya milk for vegetarians. Bar staff were slow but efficient when they served. We decided to put this down to our 'English impatience' and in the end it forced us to slow down, chill out and relax. If you want to see the sights and don't need to spend much time in your hotel then it is a terrific place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and modern hotel in the center of Madrid. The rooms are large and clean. In the bathroom, you find everything you need (from soap, toothbrush, comb and even bathrobes). The room was cleaned every day. The breakfast buffet was great. Plenty of things to choose from. But the best thing for this hotel is the location. Right in the center of Madrid and in walking distance from all the major sights. There's a metro station in 50m.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonicaItaly
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights at the end of April 2005. We had quite a good deal pricewise but as we had not made reservations directly with the hotel we were worried we would not be getting the non-smoking fifth floor room we had requested. We were however granted the room we had asked for and though it faced the busy GRAN VIA, traffic noises were not heard through the night (apart from some ambulances or police cars with sirens). The buffet breakfast was definitely quite good, and so was the room itself as regards cleanliness. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location is just perfect and this to the point that we mostly walked to the differents sights. I would strongly recommend this hotel, which I would not define as fancy but quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself as well as 3 of my friends stayed in one double room in this hotel recently. The staff was was very friendly, the rooms were clean and well appointed. We were a bit worried about the size of the room prior to our arrival due to the fact that we were trying to minimize cost by having 4 adults in the room, however we did not find it to be an issue. There were 2 twin beds and a chair that pulled out into a bed. Furthermore, the hotel was located in a very central area. I??d highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice and modern room. Very helpful hotel staff. Enjoyed my stay. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: RSMAHON
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in Jul 2003, the location is very central, similar to staying in Green Park in London. If you walk 10 mins on one direction you get to 'Old Mardic' if you walk 10 mins in the other direction you get 'New Madrid'. The room i was in was not the largest room, but had good modern decor and and lovely marble bath. There was no daylight coming into our room as we stayed in the middle of the hotel. Breakfast was nice but you need to get there early (before 9am) to get the all the buffet choice. Service was ok, but the staff smiled and were generally pleasant. The foyer is a nice place to realax and have a drink between trips. Excellent Location, Lovely decor, close to the Metro, cant complain!!
